summary: This is an FBI agent's affidavit in support of a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It details probable cause based on evidence seized from Epstein's New York residence, victim and witness interviews, and flight logs, alleging the island was used for the sexual abuse of minors and contains evidence of sex trafficking offenses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation, charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. The affidavit details his ownership of Little Saint James, his sexual abuse of multiple minor girls there and elsewhere, and his death in custody.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed multiple search warrants for Epstein's New York residence on July 6 and 7, 2019, as referenced in the affidavit.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: The magistrate judge before whom the affidavit was sworn in August 2019, as stated at the end of the document.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim who was sexually abused by Epstein in his New York residence between 2002-2005 while under 18. Provided detailed descriptions of the interior, including a 'massage room,' which was corroborated during the search.

persons.name: Individual-1
persons.context: A woman who met Epstein in 2003 when she was approximately 17. She traveled to his properties, including Little Saint James, and reported being sexually abused and raped by him there before she turned 18. She was also photographed at the island.

persons.name: Individual-2
persons.context: A contractor who worked for Epstein at Little Saint James from approximately 1999 to 2005/2006. Reported observing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls in the main residence.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions in his New York residence when she was under 18.
Epstein sexually abused and raped Individual-1 on multiple occasions, including at Little Saint James, before she turned 18. He paid for her travel and gave her money and gifts.
Individual-2 worked as a contractor for Epstein at Little Saint James from approximately 1999 to 2005/2006.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and NY Residence Search
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment. Law enforcement executed a search warrant at his New York residence, discovering a massage room, sex toys, and numerous compact discs containing images of nude/partially nude young girls.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York and pronounced dead.

events.title: Miami Herald Series Published
events.description: The Miami Herald began publishing a series of articles about Epstein's sexual misconduct with minors and a previous Florida investigation.

events.title: $250,000 Wire Transfer
events.description: Days after the Miami Herald series began, Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to an individual (redacted), which the affidavit suggests was an attempt to influence potential witnesses.

locations: Little Saint James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
St. Thomas Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The affidavit establishes probable cause that Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, contains evidence of sex trafficking of minors, including photographs of victims and co-conspirators.

A search of Epstein's New York residence in July 2019 yielded a 'massage room' matching a victim's description from 2004, sex toys, and thousands of images of nude/partially nude young girls on compact discs, some labeled 'LSJ' (Little Saint James).
Witness Individual-1 reported being raped by Epstein at Little Saint James before she turned 18 and being photographed there by a redacted individual.
Flight logs show Epstein's private jet traveled to the U.S. Virgin Islands multiple times in 2019, indicating recent use of the island.
Epstein listed Little Saint James as his primary residence on his sex offender registration in June 2019 and on his driver's license at the time of his arrest.
